document.masterDocTitle: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality and data.
“ Chile . Valparaíso ” (HT, ♂ , INIA )
.

16.II.1967
; Leg. J
.
Herrera ( IEUMCE )
;

, Leg. Etcheverry ( IEUMCE )
;

;

;

; 1♀ , Ñuñoa, 6.IV.1996 , Leg. M. Cerda; 1♀ , El Peñon, 8.III.1952 , Leg. NN (MNHNSCL);
1♂ , Malloco ,
12.X.1965
, Leg. Etcheverry ( IEUMCE )
;
2♂ , 6♀ , Quebrada de la Plata ,
27.IV.1967
, Leg. Hichins ( MEUC )
;
2♂ , 3♀ , Antumapu , La Pintana , no data, Leg. NN ( MEUC )
;
1♂ , El Volcán ,
II.1951
, Leg. Etcheverry ( IEUMCE )
.
World distribution. Argentina , Ecuador , Peru , Venezuela and Chile .
Chilean distribution. From Tarapacá to the Metropolitan region ( Fig. 187 ).
Altitudinal range. From coastal to highland ecosystems (5– 2,770 m .a.s.l.).

Biology and notes.
Eupeodes rojasi
is an important predator of the woolly apple aphid
Eriosoma lanigerum (Hausamann) ( Thompson 1999a )
. Other data about its biology or ecology are unknown.
Conservation status. LC; EOO = 117,264 km 2 , AOO = 52 km 2 and 11 localities (or subpopulations).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 187 . Distribution map of
Eupeodes
species in Chile:
Eupeodes americanus ( Wiedemann, 1830 )
(blue circles), and
Eupeodes rojasi Marnef, 1999
(red circles).
